comments.body:
If we change it, then it's a podtask, not a task.

But it's "pod" here to show the difference between the general Scheduler which potentially sees all pods and a scheduling algorithm which only sees one pod alone. One day we schedule multiple pod per offer, Then this is the very place to change in the architecture.
OK, as noted above I'd like for the package structure to offer some additional clarity between the mesos stuff and the kubernetes stuff

Right now the HA part is what bleeds into the service and through the interfaces. Without that we would be able to have the Framework be pretty self contained (with the exception of the Offer datatype which must somehow be passed through to the fcfs scheduler).
